summary.title: Autonomous Vehicles Threat Analysis
summary.description: An autonomous vehicle equipped with a variety of sensors to interpret its surroundings. The system also includes safety-related ECUs that handle sensor input and determine the vehicle's behavior accordingly.

data.name: Autonomous Vehicle
data.description: This boundry represents the physical vehicle and its internal components.

data.name: Sensors
data.description: This actor represents all types of sensors in the vehicle including Cameras, LIDARs, etc...

threats.title: Spoofing a sensors identity
threats.description:
An attacker can spoof one or all of the sensors' identities and provide false inputs to the controlling ECU, resulting in incorrect vehicle maneuvering actions.

Dread Scoring:
Damage = 4
Reproducibility = 4
Exploitability = 3
Affected Users = 1 
Discoverability = 3
threats.mitigation: All internal communication within the vehicle should be authenticated to prevent identity spoofing and the injection of malicious messages.

data.name:
Autonomous Driving 
related ECU
data.description: This is the ECU which is resposible for for intepreting the vehicle surrounding and make decisions accordingly.

data.name: Modem
data.description: This model is in charge of communication to the outer world which includes V2X communication protocols.

data.name: Request Machine Learning Model
data.description: This database stores the machine learning algorithm and all other relevant components.

data.name: Request Surrounding Analysis
data.description: The ECU provides all of the inputs it has to the machine learning process to interpert the surrounding of the vehicle and then decide how to behave.

data.name: Request maneuver
data.description: This data requests is from the ECU to the actuator requesting a specific maneuver.

data.name: Request to Parse Input/Output Messages
data.description: This request is from the modem to its inner process of parsing incoming/outgoing messages

data.name: Return parsed data
data.description: Return the parsed sensor input data

threats.title: Tampering with the message content
threats.description:
An attacker listening to the in-vehicle communication network can alter message data, causing the controlling ECU to make false maneuvering decisions, which can be deadly.

Dread Scoring:
Damage = 4
Reproducibility = 4
Exploitability = 3
Affected Users = 1 
Discoverability = 3
threats.mitigation: "All messages should include a checksum, which is then signed with a secret key to detect any tampering during transmission to their destination.

threats.title: Stealing sensor information
threats.description:
An attacker listening to the in-vehicle network communication can intercept all data transmitted from the sensors to the controlling ECU. This data may include images from the camera sensor and other private information that should not be disclosed.

Dread Scoring:
Damage = 4
Reproducibility = 4
Exploitability = 3
Affected Users = 1
Discoverability = 3
threats.mitigation: These messages should be encrypted before being transmitted over the in-vehicle communication network. This way, an attacker passively listening to the network cannot read them.

threats.title: Flooding the inner vehicle network
threats.description:
An attacker can flood the in-vehicle network, causing a denial-of-service (DoS) attack and preventing the sensors from providing any information to the controlling ECU.

Dread Scoring:
Damage = 4
Reproducibility = 4
Exploitability = 3
Affected Users = 1
Discoverability = 3
threats.mitigation: A rate-limiting measure should be applied to each element in the in-vehicle network according to its expected transmission rate.

data.name: Sending Commands
data.description: The software sends commands to the ECU

data.name: Receiving data
data.description: The sensor interactions with software to help it make decisions

threats.title: Spoofing
threats.description:
The data being send over from the sensors to the software could be tampered into making the AV to make risky decisions on the software side of the car

Damage = 4
 Reproducibility = 4
 Exploitability = 3
 Affected Users = 1 
Discoverability = 2

threats.title: Destroying the sensors
threats.description:
An attacker can use physical means to disrupt the sensors and make them inoperable, such as smashing a camera with a hammer or attaching a blocking element to the LIDAR sensor. Although the risk score is relatively high due to the ease of execution, we assume that in the real world it won't occur frequently.

Dread Scoring:
Damage = 2
Reproducibility = 4
Exploitability = 3
Affected Users = 1 
Discoverability = 4
threats.mitigation: There aren’t any real mitigations for this type of attack other than keeping your car in a secure environment. On the other hand, these attacks are loud and obvious, so we believe the likelihood of them occurring is very low. They can also be quickly detected and resolved.

threats.title: Tampering with the enviroment
threats.description:
An attacker can use physical means to trick the sensors into misperceiving or misanalyzing the environment, using methods such as 2D image printing attacks, mmWave interference, and more.

Dread Scoring:
Damage = 4
Reproducibility = 4
Exploitability = 1
Affected Users = 1 
Discoverability = 4
threats.mitigation: The best mitigation is to use multiple sensors for decision-making, so that if one sensor is under attack, the others can detect the anomaly.

data.name: Impair visual input
data.description: The rain would not allow the autonomous vehicle to analysis the surrounds

threats.title: Spoofing Rain droplets
threats.description:
Rain can make the cameras visually impaired and thus make spoofing more dangerous by hindering their accuracy.
 Damage = 4
 Reproducibility = 2
 Exploitability = 3
 Affected Users = 2
Discoverability = 2

data.name:
Analyse 
Surroundings
data.description: This process is in charge of analysing the surrounding of the vehicle.

data.name: Actuator
data.description: This actor represents all the different actuators responsible for physically operating the vehicle.

data.name:
Parse 
Messages
data.description: This process parses V2X communication messages

data.name:
Parse 
Input
data.description: This process is in charge of parsing the sensors input

data.name: V2X actor
data.description: This can be anything from a traffic light, to a stop sign, and even other vehicles.

threats.title: Software Denial of Service
threats.description:
An attacker could do a denial of service attack and overwhelm the system and exploiting vulnerabilities.  The could lead the software sending commands to the ECU to potentially cause safety risks, loss of control, and put the vehicles ability to avoid collision at risk
DREAD
Damage = 4
Reproducibility  = 4
 Exploitability =  3
Affected Users  = 1
Discoverability = 3
threats.mitigation:
Regular Security Audit
Employment Training
Response Plan
